newsitem.title: USA: US spot resid prices steady to down, demand fades.
newsitem.headline: US spot resid prices steady to down, demand fades.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices were steady to lower Wednesday in thin trade, with mild East Coast weather and cheaper natgas continuing to temper utility demand, industry sources said.

"Gas is the enemy. Oil prices are no where near gas, and there isn't much demand and not much on the horizon," said one cash trader, adding high sulphur grades seemed better supported than low sulphurs.
New York Harbor prompt one percent eased slightly to $17.25 a barrel, with Sept one percent paper little changed at $16.55-75 after trading Tuesday at $16.70, traders said.
High sulphurs in NYH were steady to down slightly, with 2.2 percent now at $15.50-75 on reports 150,000 barrels sold Tuesday to a New England utility at $15.50 (delivered Mass.).
U.S. Gulf Coast prices mostly held steady, with one percent still at $16.25-50 and three percent at about $14.75.
New York city gate September gas prices were little changed Wednesday at about $2.00/mmBtu versus NYH one percent resid at a $2.74/mmBtu equivalent.
